newsitem.title: UK: Daily Mail sets 75 mln stg bond into Reuter shares.
newsitem.headline: Daily Mail sets 75 mln stg bond into Reuter shares.

text.p: Daily Mail & General Trust Plc has issued a 75 million stg discount bond which is exchangeable into shares in Reuters Holdings Plc, it said in a statement on Friday.
Daily Mail said the new bonds will be exchangeable into Reuters shares at a 16 percent premium to its 677 pence stg mid-market closing price on Thursday.
The yield to maturity on the deal is 6.00 percent, on a semi-annual basis.
J.P. Morgan Securities will lead manage the deal.
At the same time, Daily Mail said it bought back 27.931 million stg of its outstanding 5.75 percent exchangeable-into-Reuters bond due 2003. It paid 148.189, a 7.0 percent premium.
Daily Mail announced the buy-back on Monday, May 19. Some 47.9 million stg of the issue had been outstanding.
The new 2004 bonds were given an issue price of 79.47.
